content.point: return statement passes information from inside a function back to the point in the program where it was called.
A function must be called explicitly for the code in its body to execute.
Reaching the function-ending right brace returns to the point at which a function was invoked.
Executing the statement return; returns to the point at which a function was invoked.
Executing the statement return expression; returns to the point at which a function was invoked.
All variables declared with the keyowrd var in function definitions are local variables.
Each identifier in the program has a scope.
The scope of an identifier for a variable or function is the portion of the program in which the identifier can be referenced.
JavaScript provides nine global functions as part of a Global object.
A recursive function calls itself, either directly, or indirectly through another function.
Iteration terminates when the loop-continuation condition fails while recursion terminates when a base case is recognized.
